IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RENSSELAER EDUCATES THE LEADERS OF TOMORROW FOR TECHNOLOGICALLY BASED CAREERS. WE CELEBRATE DISCOVERY AND THE RESPONSIBLE APPLICATION OF TECHNOLOGY TO CREATE KNOWLEDGE AND GLOBAL PROSPERITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SCHOLARSHIP & FELLOWSHIPNUMBER OF UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS ON SCHOLARSHIP: 4,918NUMBER OF GRADUATE STUDENTS ON SCHOLARSHIPS/FELLOWSHIPS: 971

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: AUXILIARYNUMBER OF HOUSING UNITS AVAILABLE: DORM ROOMS 2,761 SINGLE APTS 850NUMBER OF STUDENTS ON MEAL PLANS: 3,059OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE ACTIVITIES THAT FURTHER RENSSELAER'S EXEMPT PURPOSE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RENSSELAER HAS NO DIRECT OR INDIRECT POLITICAL CAMPAIGN ACTIVITIES.

INCOME EARNED ON RENSSELAER'S ENDOWMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO STUDENTS THROUGH SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND PRIZES. IN ADDITION, INCOME IS USED TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE INSTITUTE IN THE FORM OF PROFESSORSHIPS, LECTURES, DEPARTMENTAL PROGRAMS AND INSTITUTIONAL INITIATIVES.

EFFECTIVE JULY 1,2008, RENSSELAER ADOPTED THE FASB INTERPRETATION NO.48 ("FIN48"), ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES-AN INTERPRETATION OF SFAS NO.109, ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES. THE ADOPTION DID NOT HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

THE INSTITUTE SHALL BE OPEN TO ALL STUDENTS WHO ARE QUALIFIED ACCORDING TO ITS ADMISSION STANDARDS, BARRING NO ONE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, CREED, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, RELIGION, MARITAL STATUS, VETERAN STATUS, DISABILITY, SEX, OR SEXUAL ORIENTATION. EFFORTS SHALL BE MADE TO SEEK OUT AND ADMIT STUDENTS OF DIVERSE SOCIOECONOMIC BACKGROUNDS WHOSE POTENTIAL COULD BE REACHED THROUGH A RENSSELAER EDUCATION.

RESEARCH SUBCONTRACTS TO FOREIGN ENTITIES ARE ENTERED INTO THROUGH A FORMAL SUBCONTRACT AGREEMENT WHICH CONTAINS CONTRACTUAL PROVISIONS. ALL SUBRECIPIENTS ARE SUBJECT TO SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING PROCESS AND COMPLIANCE REVIEW.
ADMINISTRATION, MONITORING AND OVERSIGHT OF GRANTS IS CONDUCTED TO OVERSEE THE PROGRESS AND COMPLETION OF THE GRANTS, ENSURING COMPLIANCE WITH ALL RELEVANT TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

THE PRESIDENT IS THE ONLY EMPLOYEE ELIGIBLE FOR FIRST CLASS AND SPOUSAL/COMPANION TRAVEL. OTHER EXECUTIVES MAY BE APPROVED BASED ON MEDICAL DOCUMENTATION ONLY. RENSSELAER'S PRESIDENT IS ALLOWED TO USE FIRST CLASS TRAVEL ON RENSSELAER BUSINESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF HER EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT, WHICH WAS APPROVED BY INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE PRESIDENT'S EXPENSES ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, INCLUDING ANY AMOUNTS FOR SPOUSAL OR COMPANION TRAVEL. THE BOARD HAS OVERSIGHT OF STRATEGIC ISSUES FOR FACILITIES MANAGEMENT, WHICH INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS AND OTHER COSTS FOR RENSSELAER'S PRESIDENTIAL RESIDENCE. THE BOARD OF RENSSELAER ALSO OVERSEES THE REVIEW AND AUDIT OF EXPENSES OF THE PRESIDENT RELATING TO THE PRESIDENTIAL RESIDENCE AND PERSONAL SERVICES ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPKEEP OF THE RESIDENCE. SUCH REVIEW AND AUDIT OCCURS UNDER THE BOARD'S OVERSIGHT ON AN AT LEAST ANNUAL BASIS.

DEFERRED COMPENSATION 457(F) PLANS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED FOR THE PURPOSE OF RETAINING THE PRESIDENT AND CERTAIN KEY MEMBERS OF THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET. ALSO, ANNUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS ARE CONDUCTED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD FOR THE PRESIDENT, AND BY THE PRESIDENT IN CONSULTATION WITH THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE FOR KEY MEMBERS OF THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET. ALSO, THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE 457(F) BENEFITS UNDER THE PLANS INCLUDE A SUBSTANTIAL RISK OF FORFEITURE SHOULD THE PRESIDENT OR KEY MEMBERS OF THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET SEPARATE FROM EMPLOYMENT OR SEPARATE FOR CAUSE PRIOR TO THE AGREED UPON SERVICE DATE.

RENSSELAER MAINTAINS A PERFORMANCE INCENTIVE PROGRAM IN CONNECTION WITH THE ANNUAL EVALUATION PROCESS FOR ITS PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE OFFICERS. ELIGIBILITY FOR RECEIPT OF SUCH INCENTIVE PAYMENTS IS LIMITED TO CERTAIN EXECUTIVE OFFICERS. PERFORMANCE AWARDS ARE MADE SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD BASED UPON SUCH ANNUAL EVALUATIONS, WITH THE AMOUNT OF SUCH AWARDS, IF ANY, AT ITS DISCRETION.
ISSUER NAME: RENSSELAER COUNTY INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT AGENCY DATE THE REBATE COMPUTATION WAS PERFORMED: 12/01/2007

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING VIA A SECURE WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RENSSELAER'S TRUSTEES, INSTITUTE LEADERS, FACULTY, AND SELECTED STAFF INVOLVED IN PURCHASING, FINANCE AND BUDGETING FUNCTIONS ARE REQUIRED ANNUALLY TO REVIEW RENSSELAER'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST AND COMMITMENT POLICY AND AFFIRMATIVELY VERIFY THEY ARE FREE OF ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST OR COMMITMENT. POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND/OR COMMITMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY AN INSTITUTE-WIDE COMMITTEE. ALSO, A REPORT IS MADE TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AUDIT COMMITTEE ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RENSSELAER BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS DELEGATED THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT OF RENSSELAER TO THE COMPENSATION AND PERSONNEL DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE RETAINS AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT TO PROVIDE A COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS REPORT TO DETERMINE THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT OF RENSSELAER. THE PRESIDENT OF RENSSELAER HOLDS A NON-VOTING SEAT ON THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND DOES NOT PARTICIPATE OR ATTEND ANY DISCUSSIONS OR COMMUNICATIONS BY THE BOARD OR ITS DESIGNATED COMMITTEE WHICH ARE HELD IN CONSIDERATION OF HER OWN COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE VIA RENSSELAER'S WEBSITE. THE DISCLOSURE OF GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN PENSION OBLIGATION -53,000,952. CHANGE IN VALUE OF LIFE INCOME CONTRACTS -636,533. MISCELLANEOUS ADJUSTMENT 19,391. TRANSFERS - HARTFORD GRADUATE CNTR 1,413,333.
